page.title: 11ORWELL BRIDGE IPSWICH
page.content: This was completed in December 1982 and took a total of four years to build. It is a great feat of engineering, a high very broad concrete structure built across a tidal, mud-lined estuary. It was built to form part of the Ipswich Eastern by-pass.An attempt to keep the heavy container lorry traffic bound for Felixstowe, out of the historic centre of Ipswich.As well as the difficulties of crossing such a broad estuary,(the bridge is 1.4 Km long), another problem was to build a high enough bridge to allow ocean-going ships up to the port of Ipswich.The center arch is over 60 metres high, today the bridge gives one of the best panorama's of southern Ipswich. The bridge was constructed by a team of experts from Holland.
